bibl.title: Nabataeans in the Eastern Desert during the Roman Period.
bibl.note: Nabataean Maritime Routes on the Red Sea. - Nabataeans in Egypt. - Nabataean Inscriptions from the Late Ptolemaic Period. - Nabataean Inscriptions from the Roman Period. - Wadi Hammamat (between Qift and Quseir). - Discussion.

bibl.title: The History of the Peoples of the Eastern Desert

bibl.seg: Rageh Z. Mohamed, Nabataeans in the Eastern Desert during the Roman Period.

Hans Barnard & Kim Duistermaat (edd.), The History of the Peoples of the Eastern Desert = University of California. Cotsen Institute of Archaeology. Monograph 73 (Los Angeles, 2012) pp. 204-212, 8 figg.

Nabataean Maritime Routes on the Red Sea. - Nabataeans in Egypt. - Nabataean Inscriptions from the Late Ptolemaic Period. - Nabataean Inscriptions from the Roman Period. - Wadi Hammamat (between Qift and Quseir). - Discussion.
